page.title: 18Mentally Handicapped Home.
page.content: In March 1984 the Rev.Fieldsend,vicar of Bayston Hill,applied for outline planning permission on behalf of a charity called Christian Concern for the Mentally Handicapped.The proposed site,housing up to 12 mentally handicapped adults,is behind Christ Church,Glebe Rd.bordering the playing field and school. These proposals were outlined at a meeting,in April,attended by 150 villagers,where strong views were aired both for and against. In May 1984 outline planning permission was granted. It was reported that a petition against the proposals,signed by 242 residents,had been recieved,as had 28 letters against,3 with no objections,and 37 in favour.It was noted that,"Those who supported it lived furthest away." We now await more detailed proposals.
